title: Fragments, ca. 1690
dimensions:
A. Warp: 45.5 cm [18"] Cut top and bottom.
    Weft: 25 cm [10"] Partial selvedge on left side. Right side cut.
B. Warp: 29 cm [11.5"] Cut top and bottom. 
    Weft: 23 cm [9"] Cut both sides.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Brown damask with brocading in gold and silver metallic thread and orange silk. The brocaded pattern has allegorical figures and exotic birds and flowers.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragments, ca. 1690.
ca. 1690. Medium: silk
Technique: damassé brocaded. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1995-70-1-a,b.
